Intro:
Follow excellence, and success will follow you!! 
Skill and experiences: 
●
Experienced with Linux, Java (about 10 years). 
●
Experienced with Team Leader position (about 3-4 years).

Have got several national programming prizes.

Really love researching new technologies and algorithms.

ECR, SQS, SNS, S3, Lambda, Cognito...)

And: 
●
Java Core: Collection, Generic, Exception Handling, Multi threading, Reflection, etc… 
●
Java EE: Spring (boot, integration, MVC, data, cloud..),Hibernate. 
●
Experienced in Gaming Industry (card game, especially libGDX - game engine) 
●
Having a good knowledge about PHP, JavaScript, HTML. 
●
Familiar with ReactJS/Redux (about 6-months experience) 
●
Having a good knowledge about scalable system. 
●
Having a good knowledge about NoSQL, e.g: Memcache, Redis, MongoDB, Cassandra. 
●
Love terminal console with zsh, tmux and vim. 
●
Familiar with IntelliJ, Maven, Gradle, Eclipse, SVN, Android Studio, Visual Studio Code… 
●
Having a basic knowledge about jQuery,  Python, CSS, C/C++. 
●
Having a basic knowledge about other game engines, e.g: cocos2dx, cocos2d-js, smartfox 
Other Skills: 
●
English proficiency with 4 skills (listening, speaking, writing and especially reading). 
●
Experienced with team-leader, tech-lead, mentor position. 
●
Willing to work in high-pressure environment. 
●
Like football, swimming, jogging, listening to US-UK song, and playing DotA, PES.

===================================================================================================== 
Cover Letter 
   Dear all, 
   My name is Trung Do. I don’t intend to talk a lot of myself in Cover Letter (You could take a look at 
my CV for more details). I would like to focus on only one opinion of mine: “Sometimes, you should 
try something new. Not because new one is sure to be better, but because you will have a new 
choice and you can chose a better one for yourself”. 
    I’m delighted to talk about one of the biggest decisions of my life. I had lived in Hanoi, Vietnam for 
most of my time. Although, I really love Hanoi which become a part of my heart, but I had a decision 
to move to Saigon 1 year ago. In Hanoi, I had everything, e.g: a career, a family, friends… and I was 
also familiar with the lifestyle and weather in Hanoi. To be honest, it was difficult for me to make this 
decision. But I desired to change and knew that I really want to live in Saigon at least once in my 
life. After 1 year in Saigon, I could spend whole day talking about the differences between Hanoi 
and Saigon. Shortly, Saigon is more powerful, more dynamic and more modern than Hanoi. In my 
humble opinion, Saigon is better place to live. Finally, I decided that my family would settle in 
Saigon, and I would never regret it. 
    Another story from me! I am very good at concentrating on work, and I could work with high 
intensity for a whole day. But after that, I would come back home exhausted and was unable to 
recovery for next working day. This problem is too serious. You know, the life is a marathon, not a 
sprint. So I had tried several methods, e.g: listening to music, pushing up, and even meditating... but 
I often forgot to take a break. Fortunately, my friend introduced Pomodoro Technique to me. Simply, 
it means: start focusing for 25 minutes, then take a break for 5 minutes and repeat it over and over. 
One weakness of this approach is that sometimes my manager finds me not hard-working. But it’s 
not a big deal! This technique is not only simple, but also very effective for me to the extent that I 
have kept this habit for more than 5 years. 
    As I said, new options are sometimes not as suitable to you as they are now. For example, I had 
been playing football from when I was a child. But 2 years ago, my leg was broken due to an football 
accident. I realized that football is quite dangerous, so I decided against playing football any more. I 
went to swimming pool every weekend. Swimming is very good for your health and help you lose 
your weight. But I was not gifted with swimming, and I missed football so much. Moreover, football is 
a team sport, so that you can chat with your teammates after match. And above all, I love football, 
deep in my heart. Finally, I decided to go back to football. 
    In summary, sometimes, keeping a habit for a long time is quite boring. We know that keeping the 
habit is safer for you. But it's so interesting to try something new, you will have the opportunity to 
experience the things you have never experienced. And even if the new one does not suit you, you 
can still return to the original choice. Please, bear in mind that: "More risk, more profit". 
   Thank you for reading! 
November, 2018 
Powered by TCPDF (www.tcpdf.org)
